class src.data.preprocessing.Sorter¶

Sort dataset to align dataset samples with labels samples.

  • y (None) – Ignored

Returns:

Reorder the indexes in an ascending way first by observation then by augmentation.

X (pd.DataFrame) – Dataset that will be transformed.

Returns:

Convertor¶

class src.data.preprocessing.Convertor(agg: bool | None = None, weather: bool = True, vi: bool = True)¶

Used to transform the xarray.Dataset into pandas.DataFrame and reduce the dimention and/or tranform it.

Parameters:

  • agg (bool, optional) – If True then replace features with their aggregations along the state_dev axis (agg = min, mean, max), defaults to None

  • weather (bool, optional) – If False then remove weather data from the Dataset, defaults to True

  • vi (bool, optional) – If False then remove vegetable indices from the Dataset, defaults to True

fit(X=None, y=None) → object¶

Identity function.

Parameters:

  • X (None) – Ignored

  • y (None) – Ignored

Returns:

Convertor.

Return type:

object

transform(X: Dataset) → DataFrame¶

Transform the xarray.Dataset to pandas.Dataframe depends on the argument of the class.

Parameters:

X (xr.Dataset) – Dataset that will be transformed.

Returns:

Transformed Dataset.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Smoother¶

class src.data.preprocessing.Smoother(mode: str = 'savgol')¶

Smooth Vegetable Indice Data.

Parameters:

mode (str, optional) – methode used to smooth vi data, None to not perform smoothing during , defaults to “savgol”

Identity function.

Parameters:

Returns:

Themself.

Filler¶

class src.data.preprocessing.Filler¶

Fill dataset using the mean of each group of observation for a given date. For the reaining data use the mean of the dataset for a given developpment state.

fit(X: Dataset, y=None) → object¶

Compute mean by developpement state to be used for later filling.

Parameters:

  • X (xr.Dataset) – The data used to compute mean by developpement state used for later filling.

  • y (None) – Ignored

Returns:

self

Return type:

object

transform(X: Dataset) → Dataset¶

Performs the filling of missing values

Parameters:

X (xr.Dataset) – The dataset used to fill.

Returns:

Transformed Dataset.

Return type:

xr.Dataset

DatasetScaler¶

class src.data.datascaler.DatasetScaler(scaler_s: StandardScaler | RobustScaler | PowerTransformer | QuantileTransformer, columns_s: list[str], scaler_g: StandardScaler | RobustScaler | PowerTransformer | QuantileTransformer, columns_g: list[str], scaler_m: StandardScaler | RobustScaler | PowerTransformer | QuantileTransformer, columns_m: list[str], scaler_t: MinMaxScaler)¶

Scaler for Vegetable Indice, Geographical, Meteorological and Target.

Parameters:

  • scaler_s (Union[StandardScaler, RobustScaler, PowerTransformer, QuantileTransformer]) – Scikit-Learn scaler for Vegetable Indice data

  • columns_s (list[str]) – Vegetable Indice columns name

  • scaler_g (Union[StandardScaler, RobustScaler, PowerTransformer, QuantileTransformer]) – Scikit-Learn scaler for Geographical data

  • columns_g (list[str]) – Geographical columns name

  • scaler_m (Union[StandardScaler, RobustScaler, PowerTransformer, QuantileTransformer]) – Scikit-Learn scaler for Meteorological data

  • columns_m (list[str]) – Meteorological columns name

  • scaler_t (MinMaxScaler) – Scikit-Learn scaler for Target data

fit(xdf: Dataset, target: str) → object¶

Fit all scalers to be used for later scaling.

Parameters:

  • xdf (xr.Dataset) – The data used to fit all scalers, used for later scaling along the features axis.

  • target (str) – Column name to fit the target scaler, used for later scaling along the target axis.

Returns:

Fitted scaler.

Return type:

object

fit_transform(xdf: Dataset, target: str) → Dataset¶

Fit to data, then transform it.

Parameters:

  • xdf (xr.Dataset) – The data used to perform fit and transform.

  • target (str) – Column name used to scale along the Target axis

Returns:

Transformed Dataset.

Return type:

xr.Dataset

inverse_transform(xdf: Dataset, target: str | None = None) → Dataset¶

Scale back the data to the original representation.

Parameters:

  • xdf (xr.Dataset) – The data used to scale along the features axis.

  • target (str, optional) – Column name used to scale along the Target axis, defaults to None

Returns:

Transformed Dataset.

Return type:

xr.Dataset

transform(xdf: Dataset, target: str | None = None) → Dataset¶

Perform transform of each scaler.

Parameters:

  • xdf (xr.Dataset) – The Dataset used to scale along the features axis.

  • target (str, optional) – Column name used to scale along the Target axis, defaults to None

Returns:

Transformed Dataset.

Return type:

xr.Dataset
